<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm </U></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Board of Directors and Shareholders </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc.: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We have audited the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheet of PepsiCo, Inc. and Subsidiaries (&#147;PepsiCo,
Inc.&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;29, 2007 and December&nbsp;30, 2006, and the related Consolidated Statements of Income, Cash Flows and Common Shareholders&#146; Equity for each of the years in the three-year period ended
December&nbsp;29, 2007. We also have audited PepsiCo, Inc.&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;29, 2007, based on criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring
Organizations of the Treadway Commission (&#147;COSO&#148;). PepsiCo, Inc.&#146;s management is responsible for these consolidated financial statements, for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its assessment of
the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting appearing under Item&nbsp;9A. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated
financial statements and an opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We conducted our
audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audits to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of
material misstatement and whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audits of the consolidated financial statements included examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts
and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. Our audit of internal control over financial reporting
included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk.
Our audits also included performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial
statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that,
in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance
regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are
subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of PepsiCo, Inc. as of December&nbsp;29, 2007 and
December&nbsp;30, 2006, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December&nbsp;29, 2007, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
Also in our opinion, PepsiCo, Inc. maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;29, 2007, based on criteria established in <I>Internal Control - Integrated Framework</I> issued by
COSO. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">New York, New York</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The restructuring and impairment charges in 2007 were $102 million ($70 million or $0.04 per share after-tax). The restructuring and impairment charges in 2006
were $67 million ($43 million or $0.03 per share after-tax). See
<A HREF="#toc75177_20">Note 3</A>. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In 2007, represents non-cash tax benefits related to the favorable resolution of certain foreign tax matters. In 2006, represents non-cash tax benefits primarily
related to the IRS&#146;s examination of our consolidated income tax returns for the years 1998 through 2002. See
<A HREF="#toc75177_21">Note 5</A>. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(a)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Return on invested capital is defined as adjusted net income divided by the sum of average shareholders&#146; equity and average total debt. Adjusted net income
is defined as net income plus net interest expense after-tax. Net interest expense after-tax was $63 million in 2007, $72 million in 2006, $62 million in 2005, $60 million in 2004 and $72 million in 2003. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P

FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"> week increased 2005 net revenue by an estimated $418 million and net income by an estimated $57 million ($0.03 per share). </FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>GLOSSARY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Anchor bottlers</B>: The Pepsi Bottling Group (PBG), PepsiAmericas (PAS) and Pepsi Bottling Ventures (PBV). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>Bottler</B>: customers to whom we have granted exclusive contracts to sell and manufacture certain beverage products bearing our trademarks within a specific geographical area. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Bottler Case Sales (BCS): </B>measure of physical beverage volume shipped to retailers and independent distributors from both PepsiCo and our bottlers.<B> </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Bottler funding</B>: financial incentives we give to our bottlers to assist in the distribution and promotion of our beverage products. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Concentrate Shipments and Equivalents (CSE)</B>: measure of our physical beverage volume shipments to bottlers, retailers and independent
distributors. This measure is reported on our fiscal year basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Consumers</B>: people who eat and drink our products. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>CSD</B>: carbonated soft drinks. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>Customers</B>: authorized bottlers and independent distributors and retailers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Derivatives</B>: financial instruments that
we use to manage our risk arising from changes in commodity prices, interest rates, foreign exchange rates and stock prices. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>Direct-Store-Delivery (DSD)</B>: delivery system used by us and our bottlers to deliver snacks and beverages directly to retail stores where our products are merchandised. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Effective net pricing</B>: reflects the year-over-year impact of discrete pricing actions, sales incentive activities and mix resulting from selling varying products in different package sizes
and in different countries. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Management operating cash flow</B>: net cash provided by operating activities less capital spending plus
sales of property, plant and equipment. It is our primary measure used to monitor cash flow performance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Marketplace spending</B>:<B>
</B>sales incentives offered through various programs to our customers and consumers (trade spending), as well as advertising and other marketing activities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Servings</B>: common metric reflecting our consolidated physical unit volume. Our divisions&#146; physical unit measures are converted into servings based on U.S. Food and Drug Administration guidelines for
single-serving sizes of our products. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">103 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Smart Spot</B>:<B> </B>our initiative that helps consumers find our products that can contribute to
healthier lifestyles. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Transaction gains and losses</B>: the impact on our consolidated financial statements of exchange rate changes
arising from specific transactions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Translation adjustments</B>: the impact of the conversion of our foreign affiliates&#146; financial
statements to U.S. dollars for the purpose of consolidating our financial statements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">104 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="tx75177_10"></A>Item&nbsp;7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Included in &#147;
<A HREF="#toc75177_22">Item 7. Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis &#150; Our Business Risks</A>.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="tx75177_11"></A>Item&nbsp;8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">See &#147;
<A HREF="#toc75177_23">Item 15. Exhibits and Financial Statement Schedules</A>.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="tx75177_12"></A>Item&nbsp;9. Changes in and Disagreements With Accountants on Accounting and </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Financial Disclosure
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Not applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>
<A NAME="tx75177_13"></A>Item&nbsp;9A. Controls and Procedures </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>(a) Disclosure Controls and Procedures. </I></B>As of the end of
the period covered by this report, we carried out an evaluation, under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, of the effectiveness of the design and operation
of our disclosure controls and procedures, as such term is defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) of the Exchange Act. Based upon that evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that as of the end of the period
covered by this report, our disclosure controls and procedures were effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in reports we file or submit under the Exchange Act is (1)&nbsp;recorded, processed, summarized and reported
within the time periods specified in SEC rules and forms, and (2)&nbsp;accumulated and communicated to our management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>(b) Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. </I></B>Our management is responsible for
establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting, as such term is defined in Rule 13a-15(f) of the Exchange Act. Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer
and Chief Financial Officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting based upon the framework in <I>Internal Control &#150; Integrated Framework</I> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring
Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on that evaluation, our management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting is effective as of December&nbsp;29, 2007. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Attestation Report of the Registered Public Accounting Firm</I></B>. KPMG LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm, has audited the consolidated financial statements included
in this Annual Report on Form 10-K and, as part of their audit, has issued their report, included herein, on the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>(c) Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting. </I></B>During our fourth fiscal quarter of 2007, we continued migrating certain of our financial processing systems to </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">105 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">SAP software. This software implementation is part of our ongoing global business transformation initiative, and we plan to continue implementing such
software throughout other parts of our businesses over the course of the next few years. In connection with the SAP implementation and resulting business process changes, we continue to enhance the design and documentation of our internal control
processes to ensure suitable controls over our financial reporting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Except as described above, there were no changes in our internal
control over financial reporting that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting during our fourth fiscal quarter of 2007. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Item&nbsp;9B.
<A NAME="tx75177_14"></A>Other Information </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Not applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">106 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>PART III </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Item&nbsp;10.
<A NAME="tx75177_15"></A>Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The name, age and background of each of our directors
nominated for election are contained under the caption &#147;Election of Directors&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and are incorporated herein by reference. Pursuant to Item&nbsp;401(b) of Regulation S-K,
information about our executive officers is reported under the caption &#147;Executive Officers of the Registrant&#148; in Part I of this report. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">Information on the beneficial ownership reporting for our directors and executive officers is contained under the caption &#147;Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance&#148; in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting
of Shareholders and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We have a written code of conduct that applies to all of our employees, including
our directors, Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Controller. Our Worldwide Code of Conduct is distributed to all employees, is available on our website at <U>http://www.pepsico.com</U> and is included as
Exhibit 14 to this Annual Report on Form 10-K. A copy of our Worldwide Code of Conduct may be obtained free of charge by writing to Investor Relations, PepsiCo, Inc., 700 Anderson Hill Road, Purchase, New York 10577. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Our business and affairs are overseen by our Board of Directors pursuant to the North Carolina Business Corporation Act and our By-Laws. The Board of
Directors has three separately designated standing committees: Audit, Compensation and Nominating and Corporate Governance. The charters of these committees are available free of charge on our website at http://www.pepsico.com. The names of each of
our Audit Committee members are contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the caption &#147;Committees of the Board of Directors&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. Information on our Audit
Committee and Audit Committee financial expertise and financial literacy is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;The Audit Committee&#148; and &#147;Financial Expertise and Financial
Literacy&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. The names of each of our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee members are contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the caption
&#147;Committees of the Board of Directors&#148; and are incorporated herein by reference. Information on our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and director nomination process can be found in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual
Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee&#148; and &#147;Director Nomination Process&#148; and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Item&nbsp;11.
<A NAME="tx75177_16"></A>Executive Compensation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Information on compensation of our directors and executive officers and Compensation
Committee interlocks is contained in our Proxy Statement for our 2008 Annual Meeting of Shareholders under the captions &#147;2007 Director Compensation,&#148; &#147;Executive Compensation,&#148; and &#147;Compensation Committee Interlocks and
Insider Participation,&#148; respectively, and is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TR>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-14
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>dex14.htm
<DESCRIPTION>WORLDWIDE CODE OF CONDUCT
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Worldwide Code of Conduct</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify">

<IMG SRC="g75177image007.jpg" ALT="LOGO"> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">EXHIBIT 14 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>W<SMALL>ORLDWIDE</SMALL> C<SMALL>ODE</SMALL> O<SMALL>F</SMALL> C<SMALL>ONDUCT</SMALL> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Dear Fellow Associates:
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>PepsiCo has consistently led the industry with outstanding financial performance &#150; and we can rightfully take pride in our
accomplishments. Like all winning teams, we are constantly asking ourselves, &#147;How do the best get even better?&#148; The answer is to deliver Performance with Purpose: our vision to take PepsiCo&#146;s foundation of strength and build on it to
create a company that both generates healthy financial returns and improves the lives of our consumers, our employees and our communities. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><I>To do better by doing better, we must start with our Values and our Code of Conduct. This means delivering superior financial performance the right way, achieving results with integrity, building trust with one another and all of our
stakeholders &#150; with our Values and our Code at the center of everything we do. Our commitment to applying our Values and the Code of Conduct to all aspects of our business is critical to delivering world-class performance &#133; and doing so
with a larger purpose that makes a difference to the world we share. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>My intent is that this Code of Conduct will help guide each of
us as we work toward living our Values and making Performance with Purpose a reality. These indispensable tools serve as our unshakeable foundation. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Thank you for your support and your personal engagement in ensuring that PepsiCo remains a high-integrity company that delivers consistently strong performance the right way. </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify">

<IMG SRC="g75177image008.jpg" ALT="LOGO"></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Indra Nooyi</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><I>Chairman and Chief Executive Officer</I></FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>INTRODUCTION </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo&#146;s mission is to be the world&#146;s premier consumer products company focused on convenient foods and beverages. We seek to produce healthy financial rewards to investors as we provide opportunities for
growth and enrichment to our employees, our business partners and the communities in which we operate. In everything we do, we strive to act with honesty, fairness and integrity and to obey the laws and regulations of the countries where we do
business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Code of Conduct applies to PepsiCo, its subsidiaries throughout the world, joint ventures over which
PepsiCo has management control and to every employee of these companies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>RESPECT FOR OUR EMPLOYEES </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We believe our most important strength is our employees. We seek to provide a work environment where all employees have the opportunity to reach their
full potential and contribute to PepsiCo&#146;s success. We emphasize personal integrity and believe long-term results are the best measure of an employee&#146;s performance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo respects the human rights and the dignity of all employees. We endeavor to treat our employees fairly and honestly. We strive to maintain a safe, secure and healthy workplace and it is
against our policy to use forced or child labor. We also strive to follow all applicable employment laws and regulations. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">We are committed to equal opportunity in all aspects of employment for employees and applicants. This means providing a workplace free from any form of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. We seek to create a work
environment where people feel comfortable and respected, regardless of individual differences, talents or personal characteristics. Our objective is for the diversity of our employees to reflect the diversity of the population wherever we operate
and for the performance of all employees to be judged fairly and based on their contribution to our results. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo
encourages an inclusive culture, which enables all employees to do their best. This means we: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Welcome and embrace the strengths of our differences, </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Treat each other with respect and fairness, and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Foster an atmosphere of trust, open communications and candor. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We recognize the needs of individuals to achieve professional and personal balance in their lives. We also respect employee privacy and will acquire and retain only that employee personal
information that is required for operation of the Company&#146;s business or required by law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>CONSUMERS, CUSTOMERS, SUPPLIERS AND&nbsp;COMPETITORS </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We are committed to the continuation of free enterprise and the legal and regulatory frameworks that support it. Therefore, we recognize the importance of
laws that prohibit restraints of trade, predatory economic activities and unfair, deceptive or unethical business practices. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">In all of our business dealings with consumers, customers, suppliers and competitors, we will: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Avoid any unfair or deceptive practice and always present our services and products in an honest and forthright manner. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Treat all customers and suppliers honestly, fairly and objectively. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Select suppliers based on merit, and make clear to all suppliers that we expect them to compete fairly and vigorously for our business.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Compete vigorously and with integrity. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Never comment on a competitor&#146;s product without a good basis for such statements. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Comply with all competition laws, including those prohibiting agreements or understandings with competitors to fix prices or other sales terms, coordinate bids
or divide sales territories, customers or product lines. These types of agreements with competitors are generally illegal in the United States and many other markets where we conduct business. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>GLOBAL RELATIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo firmly
believes that international commerce strengthens stability and peace by fostering economic growth, opportunity and mutual understanding. As a global enterprise, we recognize our responsibility to act in concert with the legitimate interests of the
countries in which we do business. We will obey all applicable laws and regulations of our host countries. Our objective is to be a good corporate citizen wherever we operate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>BUSINESS GIFTS AND ENTERTAINMENT </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Our business decisions are made on merit.
Therefore, we will never give or offer, directly or indirectly, anything of value to a third party, including a government official, political party or candidate, to corruptly influence that person&#146;s business decision or gain an unfair
advantage. We will observe PepsiCo&#146;s International Anti-Bribery Policy at all times. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Giving gifts or entertainment to governmental officials is highly regulated and often
prohibited. Such gifts and entertainment should not be provided unless you have received Law Department approval. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Gifts or
entertainment given to or received from customers or suppliers must never influence, or appear to influence, business decisions. There must be a legitimate business purpose for any business gift or entertainment, it must be in good taste and it must
be consistent with the law, with the giver&#146;s and receiver&#146;s policies, PepsiCo&#146;s policies and your function/division policies (including the Travel and Entertainment Policy). If business gifts are permitted under your function/division
policies, they must be nominal in value and frequency. Customer and supplier meals and entertainment must be reasonable in cost and frequency and consistent with guidelines established by PepsiCo or your function/division. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>HEALTH AND SAFETY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo is
committed to providing safe and healthy work environments at its facilities for all its employees, visitors, contractors and vendors. It is our policy to provide employees with a drug-free workplace. In order to create an environment free from
threats, violence and intimidation, we are committed to a policy of zero tolerance for violence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We are dedicated to
designing, constructing, maintaining and operating facilities that protect our people and physical resources. It is our policy to comply with all applicable health and safety laws and regulations, provide and require the use of adequate protective
equipment and measures, and insist that all work be done in a safe and responsible manner. It is the responsibility of each employee to follow all Company policies and procedures related to workplace health and safety. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>ENVIRONMENT </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo is committed to
being an environmentally responsible corporate citizen. We are committed to minimizing the impact of our businesses on the environment with methods that are socially responsible, scientifically based and economically sound. We encourage
conservation, recycling and energy use programs that promote clean air and water, reduce landfill wastes and replenish the planet&#146;s natural resources. We will follow applicable environmental laws and regulations in the countries where we
operate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>POLITICAL AND COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES AND&nbsp;CONTRIBUTIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo believes in contributing to society and encourages employees to participate in community activities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We will continue to communicate information and opinions on issues of public concern that may affect PepsiCo. Decisions by our employees whether or not to contribute time, money or resources of
their own to any political or community activity are entirely personal and voluntary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We will obey all laws in promoting
the Company&#146;s position to government authorities and in making political contributions. Contributions by the Company to political candidates may be prohibited or regulated. Any such contribution requires the approval of PepsiCo&#146;s Vice
President of Public Policy and Government Affairs. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>CONFLICTS OF INTEREST </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo&#146;s conflicts of interest policy is straight-forward: Don&#146;t compete with PepsiCo businesses, and never let your business dealings on behalf of any of our businesses be influenced,
or appear to be influenced, by personal or family interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">All actual or apparent conflicts of interest between personal
and professional relationships must be handled honestly and ethically. You must disclose any potential conflict of interest to your supervisor as soon as you become aware of it. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Examples of conflicts that must be disclosed and resolved include: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Receiving any financial or personal benefit either yourself or through a family member from a company that does or seeks to do business with PepsiCo.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Having more than a nominal equity interest in a competitor or in a company that does or seeks to do business with PepsiCo (for example, ownership of more than 1%
of a supplier&#146;s stock). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Serving on the board of directors or providing consulting services to a company that does or seeks to do business with PepsiCo. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Owning property (such as real estate or patent rights) that PepsiCo may be interested in acquiring or leasing. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">&#149;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Having outside business interests that could affect your job performance because of the amount of time and attention diverted from your responsibilities to
PepsiCo. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION AND INSIDER&nbsp;TRADING </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">While engaged in PepsiCo business, you may receive or learn of confidential, competitively sensitive or proprietary information that has not been
disclosed to the public. Confidential or proprietary information includes all nonpublic information that, if disclosed, might be of use to competitors or might be harmful to PepsiCo, our suppliers or our customers. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">You always have a duty to protect the confidential information of PepsiCo and our business partners. You may not disclose confidential
information to anyone outside PepsiCo, even to members of your own family, unless there is a clear business need to do so, the party receiving the information has signed a confidentiality agreement committing to maintain the information&#146;s
confidentiality and you believe that the disclosure will not harm or embarrass PepsiCo or its business partners. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo
obeys all laws with respect to the disclosure of material, non-public information. Information is considered material if a reasonable investor would consider it important to his or her decision to buy or sell PepsiCo stock. Examples of material
information include: a significant upward or downward revision of earnings forecasts; a significant division restructuring; a major management change; a significant acquisition or divestiture; a significant upcoming product launch or product
innovation. Employees should not trade in PepsiCo securities or the securities of another company involved with PepsiCo while they have material, non-public information about PepsiCo or that company. In addition, employees should not disclose
material, non-public information about PepsiCo or another company to anyone outside the Company, including family members. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>ACCOUNTS AND
RECORD-KEEPING </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We will continue to observe the most stringent standards in the keeping of our financial records and accounts. Our books
and records must reflect all components of transactions, as well as our own standard of insisting upon an honest and forthright presentation of the facts. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We will ensure that the disclosures we make in reports and documents that we submit to the Securities and Exchange Commission and in other public communications are full, fair, accurate, timely and understandable.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">It is the responsibility of each employee to uphold these standards. Appropriate records must be kept of all transactions
and retained in accordance with PepsiCo&#146;s Records Management Policy and Records Retention Schedule. Employees are expected to cooperate fully with our internal and external auditors. Information must not be falsified or concealed under any
circumstance, and an employee whose activities cause false financial reporting will be subject to disciplinary action, including termination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3"><B>PROTECTION AND PROPER USE OF COMPANY&nbsp;ASSETS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo&#146;s technological resources, including computers, voicemail,
e-mail and Internet access, are to be used for proper purposes in a manner consistent with the Code and all other Company policies, including those related to discrimination, harassment and intellectual property. As with all PepsiCo assets, these
resources are to be used for business purposes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">It is generally not PepsiCo&#146;s intent to monitor Internet access or
messages on the voicemail and e-mail systems. However, the Company reserves the right to do so in appropriate circumstances, consistent with applicable laws and regulations. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">If you have access to PepsiCo information systems, you are responsible for taking the precautions necessary to prohibit unauthorized access to the system. You should safeguard your passwords or
other means of entry. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Employees must not reproduce software assets licensed to PepsiCo, use illegally obtained software or
distribute the original software media or unauthorized copies of software which the Company does not own or license. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>REPORTING
POTENTIAL VIOLATIONS OF THE CODE OF CONDUCT </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo expects its employees, contractors, agents, customers and suppliers to promptly
report any conduct or situation that she/he believes conflicts with this Code or violates a local, state or federal law to their immediate supervisor, Human Resources or through the PepsiCo Speak Up line at: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1-866-729-4888 (from the U.S., Canada, Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands) </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For a list of phone numbers for all other countries, go to: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="3">http://www.pepsico.com/PEP_Citizenship/CodeofConduct/SpeakUp/index.cfm </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Reports can be made anonymously, and the Speak Up line is available toll-free 24 hours a
day. PepsiCo is committed to reviewing any report made in good faith in a prompt manner and taking remedial action when appropriate. Every affected employee is required to fully cooperate with any inquiry that results from any reported conduct or
situation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo is also committed to protecting the rights of those individuals who report these issues to PepsiCo. Any
PepsiCo employee who is found to have engaged in retaliation against any employee who has exercised his/her rights under this Code or under applicable laws will be subject to appropriate remedial action. In addition, those individuals who violate
applicable law may also be subject to civil and criminal penalties. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>RESPONSIBILITY FOR COMPLIANCE </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">All employees are expected to display responsible and ethical behavior, to follow consistently both the meaning and intent of this Code
and to act with integrity on a daily basis. Managers and leaders are expected to ensure that our business processes and practices reinforce the Code, to serve as positive role models by establishing and adhering to high ethical standards, and to
create an ethical culture by encouraging and rewarding actions that are consistent with the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Code cannot provide
definitive answers to all questions. For that, we must rely on each person&#146;s judgment and integrity. You are encouraged to seek guidance when a situation may not be clear. Your supervisor, Human Resources manager or the PepsiCo Law Department
will respond to questions and issues of interpretation about this Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Waivers of this Code will be reviewed by the
General Auditor and General Counsel, and in certain circumstances by the Board of Directors, and if required, will be appropriately disclosed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5 </FONT></P>

</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Alimentos Quaker Oats y Compania Limitada</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Guatemala</FONT></P></TD></TR>

<DESCRIPTION>CONSENT OF KPMG LLP

<TITLE>Consent of KPMG LLP</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 23 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:14px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Consent of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:14px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Board of Directors and Shareholders
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc.: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We consent to
incorporation by reference in the registration statements and Forms listed below of PepsiCo, Inc. and Subsidiaries (&#147;PepsiCo, Inc.&#148;) of our report dated February&nbsp;15, 2008, with respect to the Consolidated Balance Sheet of PepsiCo,
Inc. as of December&nbsp;29, 2007 and December&nbsp;30, 2006 and the related Consolidated Statements of Income, Cash Flows and Common Shareholders&#146; Equity for each of the years in the three-year period ended December&nbsp;29, 2007, and the
effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;29, 2007, which report appears in the December&nbsp;29, 2007 annual report on Form 10-K of PepsiCo, Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:14px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Description, Registration Statement Number </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:14px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>Form S-3 </U> </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>POWER OF ATTORNEY
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Power of Attorney</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 24</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo, Inc. (&#147;PepsiCo&#148;) and each of the undersigned, an officer or
director, or both, of PepsiCo, do hereby appoint Larry D. Thompson and Thomas H. Tamoney, Jr., and each of them severally, its, his or her true and lawful attorney-in-fact to execute on behalf of PepsiCo and the undersigned the following documents
and any and all amendments thereto (including post-effective amendments): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(i)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Automatic Shelf Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-133735 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock, Debt Securities, Warrants and Units;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ii)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;33-53232, 33-64243 and 333-102035 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo&#146;s Debt Securities, Warrants and Guarantees;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iii)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;33-4635, 33-21607, 33-30372, 33-31844, 33-37271, 33-37978, 33-47314, 33-47527, 333-53436 and 333-56302 all relating to the
primary and/or secondary offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock issued or exchanged in connection with acquisition transactions; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(iv)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;33-29037, 33-35602, 33-42058, 33-51496, 33-54731 33-42121, 33-50685, 33-66150 and 333-109513 relating to the offer and sale of
PepsiCo Common Stock under the PepsiCo SharePower Stock Option Plan; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(v)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;2-82645, 33-51514, 33-60965 and 333-89265 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the PepsiCo 401(k) Plan
or the PepsiCo Long-Term Savings Program; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-56524 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the PepsiCo Puerto Rico 1165(e) Plan; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-65992 relating to the offer
and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the Retirement Savings and Investment Plan for Union Employees of Tropicana Products, Inc. and Affiliates (Teamsters Local Union #173), the Retirement Savings and Investment Plan for Union Employees of
Tropicana Products, Inc. and Affiliates; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-66634 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The Quaker 401(k) Plan for Salaried Employees and The Quaker 401(k) Plan for Hourly Employees;
Registration No.&nbsp;333-76196 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The PepsiCo 401(k) Plan for Salaried Employees; and Registration No.&nbsp;333-76204 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The PepsiCo
401(k) Plan for Hourly Employees; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(vi)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statements No.&nbsp;33-61731, 333-09363 and 333-109514 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The PepsiCo, Inc. 1995 Stock
Option Incentive Plan; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;33-54733 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The PepsiCo, Inc. 1994 Long- Term Incentive Plan and resales of such shares by executive officers of PepsiCo; Registration
Statement No.&nbsp;33-19539 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under PepsiCo&#146;s 1987 Incentive Plan and resales of such shares by executive officers of PepsiCo; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;2-65410 relating to the offer
and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under PepsiCo&#146;s 1979 Incentive Plan and 1972 Performance Share Plan, as amended; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-66632 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The Quaker Long Term
Incentive Plan of 1990, The Quaker Long Term Incentive Plan of 1999, and The Quaker Oats Company Stock Option Plan for Outside Directors; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-109509 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the
PepsiCo, Inc. 2003 Long-Term Incentive Plan and resales of such shares by executive officers and directors of PepsiCo; Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-142811 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under the PepsiCo, Inc.
Long-Term Incentive Plan; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(vii)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statement No.&nbsp;33-22970 and 333-110030 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under PepsiCo&#146;s Director Stock Plan and
resales of such shares by Directors of PepsiCo; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(viii)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Registration Statement No.&nbsp;333-87526 relating to the offer and sale of PepsiCo Common Stock under The PepsiCo Share Award Plan;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(ix)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Schedule 13G relating to PepsiCo&#146;s beneficial ownership of Common Stock and Class B Common Stock of The Pepsi Bottling Group, Schedule 13D relating to
PepsiCo&#146;s beneficial ownership of Common Stock of PepsiAmericas, Inc., any amendments to such schedule 13D or Schedule 13G and any schedules to such 13D, 13G or any amendment thereto deemed to be necessary or appropriate by any such
attorney-in-fact; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">(x)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">all other applications, reports, registrations, information, documents and instruments filed or required to be filed by PepsiCo with the Securities and Exchange
Commission, any stock exchanges or any governmental official or agency in connection with the listing, registration or approval of PepsiCo Common Stock, PepsiCo debt securities or warrants, other securities or PepsiCo guarantees of its
subsidiaries&#146; debt securities or warrants, or the offer and sale thereof, or in order to meet PepsiCo&#146;s reporting requirements to such entities or persons; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto and other documents in connection therewith, and each of such attorneys shall have the power to act hereunder with or without the other.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has executed this instrument on February&nbsp;15, 2008. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>dex31.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF CEO AND CFO PURSUANT TO SECTION 302
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Certification of CEO and CFO pursuant to Section 302</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 31 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>CERTIFICATION </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">I, <B>Indra K. Nooyi, </B>certify that: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of PepsiCo, Inc. (PepsiCo); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">3.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of PepsiCo as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">4.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for PepsiCo and have: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">a)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to PepsiCo, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">b)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to
provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">c)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Evaluated the effectiveness of PepsiCo&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">d)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Disclosed in this report any change in PepsiCo&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during PepsiCo&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter that
has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, PepsiCo&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">5.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PepsiCo&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to PepsiCo&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of PepsiCo&#146;s board of directors: </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">a)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to
adversely affect PepsiCo&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">b)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in PepsiCo&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Date: February&nbsp;15, 2008</FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>

SIZE="3">Chairman of the Board of Directors</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">and Chief Executive Officer</FONT></P></TD></TR>

made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF CEO AND CFO PURSUANT TO SECTION 906
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Certification of CEO and CFO pursuant to Section 906</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>EXHIBIT 32 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002 </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In connection with the Annual Report of PepsiCo, Inc. (the &#147;Corporation&#148;) on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;29, 2007 as
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, Indra K. Nooyi, Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer of the Corporation, certify to my knowledge, pursuant to
Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350), that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">1.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="justify"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">2.</FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Corporation.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="3">CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT

certify to my knowledge, pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350), that: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
